text: I had not heard of Arcade magazine, but one of their recent issues is on Data Culture and the content is online. Iâ€™m only part of the way through but there are some good pieces.

also i think we should subscribe to this magazine
We should also scour the contagious magazine archives (online or in library) for inspiration
Was just thinking that

crazy idea #5 (I think that's what I'm up to): sandwich a layer of ferrofluid mixed with water behind a pane of glass or acrylic. above and below the ferrofluid mixture there is an array of electromagnets. when you send current through one of the electromagnets on top it will attract the ferrofluid below it. Do this for all the electromagnets and you can distort the liquid into a graph like thing
<http://i00.i.aliimg.com/wsphoto/v0/1995373010_1/Free-Shipping-5Pieces-Ferrofluid-Magnetic-Display-Ferrofluid-in-a-Bottle-ferromagnetic-fluid.jpg>
<http://theupscout.com/tech/ferrolic-clock/>?

attachments.text: This crazy clock uses ferro fluid to create a mesmerizing animation of numbers seeming to come together from blob like creatures moving around in...

rear project?

but that is a guess
